docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: Believing that you would publish willingly anything having for its object the relief of the suffering, I am emboldened to address a few lines to you on the condtion of the work-women of New-York, hoping that these...

headline.main: Hardships and Under-pay of the Sewing Girls.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: Believing that you would publish willingly anything having for its object the relief of the suffering, I am emboldened to address a few lines to you on the condtion of the work-women of New-York, hoping that these lines, though simply written, may serve to awaken a little public interest in regard to them.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE. THE FULTON OFF CAPE RACE. No News of the Atlantic Telegraph Fleet. IMPORTANT FROM INDIA. SEVERE FIGHTING IN VARIOUS QUARTERS.Cotton and Breadstuffs Improved-Consols 95 3-8@95 1-2. [By the Newfoundland and American Telegraph Company's Lines Office No. 21 Wall-street.] SEVERE FIGHTING IN VARIOUS QUARTERS. IMPORTANT FROM INDIA. FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE. THE FULTON OFF CAPE RACE. No News of the Atlantic Telegraph Fleet.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Fulton, Capt WOTTON, from Ilavre and Southampton 30th ult., passed Cape Race at 8 o'clock yesterday morning. She was intercepted by the news-yacht of the Associated Press, which arrived here shortly after noon to-day with the following summary of her mews : The Fulton has 110 passengers for New-York. She had strong westerly winds to the Banks, but reports having seen no ice.

docs.snippet: PLYMOUTH CHURCH SABBATH-SCHOOL. Sabbath-School attached to Plymouth Church yesterday closed its sessions for a Summer vacation, and the occasion was improved to afford the children, their parents and the friends of the school a chearful time at...
docs.lead_paragraph: PLYMOUTH CHURCH SABBATH-SCHOOL. Sabbath-School attached to Plymouth Church yesterday closed its sessions for a Summer vacation, and the occasion was improved to afford the children, their parents and the friends of the school a chearful time at parting. Bouquets of the most beautiful flowers bedecked the room,

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; The New-York Regiment--The Congressional Elections--A Double Lance--Trouble with an Attached--The Wilson--Gwin Affair-- Mayor Berreit.

docs.snippet: THE HEAT AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH.--Notwithstanding the excessive heat of the past ten days, there appears to have been an actual improvement in the state of the public health, as indicated by the reports of the City Inspector.' The deaths during the...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HEAT AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH.--Notwithstanding the excessive heat of the past ten days, there appears to have been an actual improvement in the state of the public health, as indicated by the reports of the City Inspector.' The deaths during the week ending on Saturday were but 442, being a decrease from the week before.

docs.snippet: A CONVERTED ACTOR.--According to announcement in the City papers, a sermon was preached at the Baptist Chapel, Harlem, by the Rev. Mr. STRICKLAND, lately belonging to the sock and buskin, but who has been converted, baptized, and ordained as a...
docs.lead_paragraph: A CONVERTED ACTOR.--According to announcement in the City papers, a sermon was preached at the Baptist Chapel, Harlem, by the Rev. Mr. STRICKLAND, lately belonging to the sock and buskin, but who has been converted, baptized, and ordained as a preacher, in connection with the Baptist Church. Tile congregation was a very numerous one, as might have been expected from the novelty of the circumstance of an actor turned preacher.

docs.lead_paragraph: MORE MORTALITY ON SHIPBOARD.-AFFAIRS AT Or?? --The brig Mary Alvira, of Boston, Captain DALY, (late Captain WYMAN,) arrived at Quarantine on Saturday, from St. Jago de Cuba, which port she left on the 19th of June. She had a cargo of sugar and tobacco, consigned to H. D. BROOKMAN, a crew of seven, and six passengers. Shortly after leaving port the yellow fever made its appearance on

headline.main: MASSACHUSETTS.; The Celebration of Independence Day--Orations by Holmes and Cheate--Murder in Somerville--Expected Call of the Democratic State Convention--The Spectre of Unconstitutionality Raised--Mr. Sumner, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 5th of July could not have been a better day, in point of weather, if man had had the making of it-and he is conceited enough to think he can improve all things. The day was sunshiny and breezy, and with as little dust about it as ever shows itself in Summer.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN ENGLAND.; Speech of Mr. Bright on India Affairs--Position of the Ministry--Relations with the United States--Mons. Belly's Grant--Mr. Peabody's Dinner.

docs.lead_paragraph: If anybody who has seen him since his return from the Continent, ever entertained any doubt that Mr. BRIGHT had quite recovered from the sudden blow which prostrated for a time his clear and vigorous intellect, I trust that skeptic was present in the Commons Hall of the English Parliament last night.
